author_bio.name: About This Plugin
author_bio.description:
This plugin shows the top free or paid Android apps available on the Play Store, using data from appfollow.io. You can select a specific country and also a specific app category (e.g.: games).

It was created by Daniel Sitnik, Principal Architect @ Accenture Brazil and creator of small things. Want a custom TRMNL Plugin for you? Check my ko-fi page or e-mail me! ðŸ˜€

author_bio.name: About This Plugin
author_bio.description: Upcoming holidays in Canada, whether nation wide or only for your province. Created by Mario Lurig @ TRMNL.

custom_fields.name: About This Plugin
custom_fields.description: Upcoming holidays in Canada, whether nation wide or only for your province. Created by Mario Lurig @ TRMNL.

custom_fields.name: Province
custom_fields.description:
See only a specific province (including optional holidays)?
Default is "Please select..." (all provinces, no optional holidays).
custom_fields.help_text: For instance, Remembrance Day is not a public holiday in Ontario per the ESA, so the holiday is shown without the "ON" label when viewing all provinces, but shows if you select "Ontario" because it is optional/common.

author_bio.name: About This Plugin (v1.0.2)
author_bio.description:
Plugin created by Frederico Rodrigues (Discord @fredericotr). External API hosted and maintained by WebPlug. Need a custom TRMNL Plugin or an External API? Please get in touch.

[HOW TO SETUP THIS PLUGIN]
1) Add my Discord APP (WebPlug COMMS) to your server using this link and select the "Text Permissions" button.
2) After authentication, you will be redirected to a page that will display a "User Private Key". Copy this key and paste it here in the TRMNL field.
3) Add the APP to each channel that you want the messages to be displayed on the device.
4) Configure all the mandatory fields.

custom_fields.name: About This Plugin (v1.0.2)
custom_fields.description:
Plugin created by Frederico Rodrigues (Discord @fredericotr). External API hosted and maintained by WebPlug. Need a custom TRMNL Plugin or an External API? Please get in touch.

[HOW TO SETUP THIS PLUGIN]
1) Add my Discord APP (WebPlug COMMS) to your server using this link and select the "Text Permissions" button.
2) After authentication, you will be redirected to a page that will display a "User Private Key". Copy this key and paste it here in the TRMNL field.
3) Add the APP to each channel that you want the messages to be displayed on the device.
4) Configure all the mandatory fields.

custom_fields.name: New Message Threshold (mins)
custom_fields.description: Number of minutes an old message can be, and still be considered "NEW".

custom_fields.name: User Private Key
custom_fields.description:
This key is displayed on the page after authentication, see instruction 2).
If you did not copy this key, repeat instructions 1) and 2).

custom_fields.name: Channels Names and IDs
custom_fields.description:
Explanation:
â€¢ Name is optional, if present, it will be used to display on the device, if not, the channel name will be get from the Discord API.
â€¢ Id is mandatory, it's the Discord Channel ID. Check how to get the Channel ID on this link.

This field uses JSON format as follows:
â€¢ For one channel, use the format [{"name":"Test Channel","id":"1433458380223021193"}]
â€¢ For more than one channel, use the format [{"name":"Test Channel","id":"1433458380223021193"},{"name":"Test Channel 2","id":"1258009045759955004"}]

author_bio.description: Shows a random chinese proverb. English and french translations are available. Some hurtful proverbs are already excluded but I can't ensure all proverbs that may hurt you won't be shown. Please contact me if you find one.

author_bio.name: About This Plugin
author_bio.description: A random typeface from Google Fonts on each refresh.

custom_fields.name: About This Plugin
custom_fields.description: A random typeface from Google Fonts on each refresh.

custom_fields.name: Font selection
custom_fields.description: Select which fonts to include in the random selection. Leave empty to include all fonts.
custom_fields.help_text:
Examples: Only select fonts for Latin script:
f.primary_language.endsWith('Latn') Only select pixel fonts:
f.qualities?.some(q => q.quality == 'Pixel') Only select variable fonts:
f.axes?.length > 0 Only select fonts that support extended Cyrillic:
f.subsets.includes('cyrillic-ext') Only select the latest font published:
f == array.reduce((latest, current) => new Date(current.date_added) > new Date(latest.date_added) ? current : latest) Technical details:
This field is a JavaScript expression that is evaluated for the metadata of each font. The font metadata is available as the variable f, index available as index, and the entire font array available as array.
Check the metadata properties here under $.fonts[]: https://blueset.github.io/google-fonts-metadata/metadata.json

custom_fields.name: Sample text override
custom_fields.description: Override sample text with your custom string
custom_fields.help_text:
large: Single-line sample text, only visible in full size.
small: Multi-line sample text, visible in all sizes.
Examples: Override all fonts:
{ "large": [ ["1", "The quick brown fox jumps over the lazy dog."] ], "small": [ ["1", "Few black taxis drive up major roads on quiet hazy nights."] ] } Override fonts for Latin script:
{ "large": [ ["f.primary_language.endsWith('Latn')", "The quick brown fox jumps over the lazy dog."] ] } Override fonts for full Japanese fonts and Hiragana only fonts:
{ "large": [ ["f.primary_language.endsWith('Jpan')", "æ„›ã®ã‚ã‚‹ãƒ¦ãƒ‹ãƒ¼ã‚¯ã§è±Šã‹ãªæ›¸ä½“"], ["f.primary_language.endsWith('Hira')", "ã‚†ã«ã„ãã§ã‚†ãŸã‹ãªã‚ã„ã®ã‚‚ã˜"] ] } Technical details for TypeScript savvy: interface OverrideConfig { [size: "small" | "large"]?: Array<[ /** * The condition to match. This is a JavaScript expression where `f` is the font metadata object. * You can use any valid JavaScript expression to check properties of the font. * Check the metadata properties here under `$.fonts[]`: * @see https://blueset.github.io/google-fonts-metadata/metadata.json */ condition: string, /** The sample text to use when the condition matches. */ sampleText: string ]> }
